alert.note: Alert for Le Flore (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 1:27PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Franklin, southeastern Crawford, central Sebastian and northeastern Le Flore Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 127 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Charleston to 2 miles east of Greenwood to 2 miles southwest of Excelsior to near Cameron. Movement was northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Poteau... Charleston... Greenwood... Barling... Pocola... Lavaca... Spiro... Mulberry... Panama... Dyer... Hackett... Bonanza... Cameron... Excelsior... Bloomer... Burnville... Jenny Lind... Shady Point... Kibler... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 15 and 20. Interstate 540 between mile markers 13 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
